unnormalised: ## Lights, Camera, Festival! Why Film Festivals Are Totally Worth It
normalised: ## Lights, Camera, Festival! Why Film Festivals Are Totally Worth It

unnormalised: Hey Bollywood buffs and cinephiles! Ever wondered what's cooler than binge-watching movies at home with a plate of samosas? Attending a film festival, duh! Think of it as a giant celebration of storytelling, where you get to rub shoulders with talented filmmakers and discover hidden gems you wouldn't find anywhere else.
normalised: Hey Bollywood buffs and cinephiles! Ever wondered what is cooler than binge-watching movies at home with a plate of samosas? Attending a film festival, duh! Think of it as a giant celebration of storytelling, where you get to rub shoulders with talented filmmakers and discover hidden gems you wouldn't find anywhere else.

unnormalised: Forget the predictable blockbusters, film festivals are where you uncover the indie magic. I'm talking about the kind of movies that make you think, feel, and maybe even shed a tear (or two). Plus, you get to see films from all over the world, from the vibrant streets of Mumbai to the snowy peaks of Switzerland – without even needing a visa!

unnormalised: Remember that scene in "Om Shanti Om" where everyone's clamoring to get into a premiere? Well, film festivals have that same electric energy. Imagine yourself at the International Film Festival of India (IFFI) in Goa, soaking up the sun, the sand, and of course, incredible films. Or even smaller regional festivals, like the one in Dharamshala – the vibes are just amazing!

unnormalised: It's not just about watching movies though. You get Q&As with directors, workshops where you can learn the secrets of filmmaking, and after-parties where you can chat with fellow film lovers. I once met a guy who'd travelled 1500 km just to see a specific documentary at a festival in Kerala! That's dedication, folks.

unnormalised: And let’s be real, it’s the perfect place to impress your crush with your sophisticated taste in cinema. "Oh, you haven't seen 'Lipstick Under My Burkha' yet? Let me tell you about this amazing independent director..." Boom. Instant connection.

unnormalised: Plus, many festivals offer student discounts and early bird passes, so you don't have to break the bank to attend. Some even offer accommodations at subsidized rates (around Rs. 500 per night!). So, what are you waiting for? Check out your local listings, grab your popcorn, and get ready to dive into the wonderful world of film festivals! You might just discover your next favorite movie – or even your future career!
